user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtBinFile2Mem:
```c
bool UtBinFile2Mem(void *Memory, const char *Filename, uint32 Length)
{
    FILE *fp;
    bool  Success;

    Success = false;
    if ((fp = fopen(Filename, "r")))
    {
        if (fread(Memory, Length, 1, fp) == 1)
        {
            Success = true;
        }
        fclose(fp);
    }
    else
    {
        UtAssert_Failed("UtBinFile2Mem: Error Opening %s: %s", Filename, strerror(errno));
    }

    return Success;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function UtBinFile2Mem:
#define UtAssert_Failed(__VA_ARGS__) UtAssertEx(false,UtAssert_GetContext(),__FILE__,__LINE__,__VA_ARGS__)
...
UtAssert_CaseType_t UtAssert_GetContext(void)
{
    return DefaultContext;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No occurrences of the Standard Library function memcmp are present in the supplied code fragments (the UtBinFile2Mem function and the shown macro/getter definitions). The code does not perform any string comparisons (only file I/O and an assertion call). The UtAssert_Failed macro expands to UtAssertEx(...), but the implementation of UtAssertEx is not included among the provided code; nothing in the shown definitions calls memcmp. Therefore there are no places in the provided code that need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 (which specifically forbids using memcmp to compare null-terminated strings). If the reviewer wants to be thorough, they may inspect the implementation of UtAssertEx (not provided) or any other external modules, but within the supplied code there are no memcmp uses to flag.
